fields.name: date
fields.description: Service date. References GTFS

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Recorded event time, including for transactions that may be aggregated values associated with a trip or vehicle.

fields.name: transaction_id
fields.description: Identifies the fare transaction.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Value of the transaction.

fields.name: currency_type
fields.description: Currency used for the transaction. References GTFS

fields.name: fare_action
fields.description:
Indicates the type of action performed. Valid options are:
0 - Unknown action type.
1 - Purchase.
2 - Enter (enter fare-controlled area or vehicle).
3 - Exit (exit fare-controlled area or vehicle).
4 - Transfer entrance.
5 - Transfer exit.
6 - Add (add stored value).
7 - Activate (activate a fare pass).
8 - Adjust (adjustment initiated by system or customer support).
9 - Other.

fields.name: trip_id_performed
fields.title: ID referencing trips_performed.trip_id_performed
fields.description: Identifies the trip performed. May be null if the fare collection device is NOT located on a vehicle. May be null if on a vehicle but trip-level data is unavailable, in which case the data would be associated with the vehicle.

fields.name: stop_sequence
fields.title: positive integer referencing stop_times.stop_sequence
fields.description: Ordered stop the vehicle is serving on a particular trip. May be null if the fare collection device is NOT located on a vehicle. May be null if on a vehicle but stop-level data is unavailable, in which case the data would be associated with the vehicle and/or trip. References GTFS

fields.name: vehicle_id
fields.title: ID referencing vehicles.vehicle_id
fields.description: Identifies the vehicle. May be null if collection device is NOT located on a vehicle. May be null if on a vehicle but vehicle data is unavailable, in which case the data would be associated with a trip and/or stop.

fields.name: device_id
fields.title: ID referencing devices.device_id
fields.description: Identifies the ITS device on which the fare transaction was performed. May be null if only a single device is reporting fare transactions on a vehicle and vehicle_id is provided. May be null if only a single device is reporting fare transactions at a stop and stop_id is provided.

fields.name: fare_id
fields.title: ID referencing fare_attributes.fare_id
fields.description: Identifies a fare class, as included in the GTFS Fare_attributes file. References GTFS

fields.name: stop_id
fields.title: ID referencing stops.stop_id
fields.description: Identifies the stop. References GTFS

fields.name: group_size
fields.description: The number of customers included in the transaction.

fields.name: media_type
fields.description:
Indicates the fare medium that was used for the transaction. Valid options are:
0 - Cash or coins.
1 - Smart card or ticket.
2 - Magnetic-stripe card or ticket.
3 - Bank card (credit or debit card).
4 - Mobile NFC (smartphone tap, etc.).
5 - Optical scan (of mobile app screen or paper ticket).
6 - Button pressed by driver or operator to indicate a boarding or alighting passenger.
7 - Other type.

fields.name: rider_category
fields.description:
Indicates rider category (categories defined by transit agency). For example:
Adult
Youth
Student
Senior
Other reduced

fields.name: fare_product
fields.description:
Indicates the fare group (fare groups defined by transit agency). For example:
Single ride
Pass
Employer sponsored
Other pass

fields.name: fare_period
fields.description:
Indicates the fare period (fare periods defined by transit agency). For example:
All day
Peak
Off-peak
Summer
Other

fields.name: fare_capped
fields.description:
Indicates if fare capping is in effect (fare capping options defined by transit agency). Valid options are:
0 - Fare is not capped.
1 - Fare is capped.

fields.name: fare_media_id
fields.description: Identifies the individual fare medium used for the transaction. For example, the fare card ID.

fields.name: fare_media_id_purchased
fields.description: Identifies the individual fare medium purchased in the transaction. For example, the fare card ID.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Stored value remaining on an account after the transaction is made.

name: fare_transactions.schema.json
description: Timestamped fare transaction, associated with devices.
